poem:
"Of Tarmac and Time"

A crack spreads through Wiltshire's skin,
Skateboards sing, steel arks skim on broken bones.
A road's descent into the belly of earth,
Becomes a playground, echoing the hum of youth.
Two years transform landslip to landmark,
Repair awaits, progress' determined dance.
Let it be! let it be! shout wheels spinning,
Yet, the echo, becomes only silence.
